ovdesc.p: This is the main table where all the items/events that may be monitored are defined.

desc.p: This field is to allow extra filtering and validation at the subscription level to indicate if this event can be subscribed by a customer or DAO or both. If defined as GLOBAL, then the customer cannot subscribe or un-subscribe to this event.
1. Possible Values - INTERNAL, EXTERNAL, BOTH, GLOBAL
2. Mandatory if Item classification is 'BUSINESS' and when EVENT.API is not defined
This field is used for the web services execution.
We can specify API’s in the TEC.SUBSCRIBER record and It can be used to execute web services.
EVENT.LIST is a flat table which would be updated if this field contains any value, and it has been referred again for the alert processing.
1.1-35 (Alphanumeric) characters.
2.Non Mandatory field.
3.This field has a check file validation to TEC.SUBSCRIBER application.
This field contains standard T24 operands.

1. Possible values - 'equals'(EQ), ‘matches’(LK), ‘not equal to ‘(NE), ‘greater than’(GT), ‘greater than or equals’(GE), ‘less than’(LT), ‘less than or equals’(LE), ‘between’(RG), ‘not between’(NR), ‘contains’(CT), ‘not containing’(NC),‘begins with’(BW), ‘ends with’(EW), ‘does not begin with’(DNBW), ‘does not end with’(DNEW)
2. Mandatory if Item classification is 'BUSINESS' and when EVENT.API is not defined.
3. NOCHANGE field
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.

To indicate whether the particular event is one-time event or not. If set to YES, it will do automatic unsubscription of event from ACCOUNT/DAO. Automatic unsubscription is not possible during COB when used with DAO.
1. Possible Value - YES
2. NOCHANGE field
This field indicates the status of this TEC ITEM.
1.Possible Values – ACTIVE,INACTIVE
2. Input allowed only when ITEM.CLASSIFICATION is ‘BUSINESS’
3. Default is INACTIVE
This field is used to identify the Metric type of the TEC.ITEMS. We have to specify the metric type based on the usability of the TEC ITEMS record.
1.1-35 type A (alpha) characters.
2.Non Mandatory field.
3.Allowed values –SIZE, TIME and COUNT
4.If TIME is specified here then the value entered in THRESHOLD would be treated in mille seconds
5.If SIZE is specified here then the value entered in THRESHOLD would be treated in bytes
Examples:
READ.SIZE – Size of the record when a READ happening on the record- This TEC ITEM is based on “SIZE”
READ.RESPOSE – Time taken to READ a particular record –This one is based on “TIME”
LOCK.COLLISION – Number of LOCK collision – This one is based on the “COUNT”

This field contains the test value for the content of the field defined in FIELD. Typically this is supplied during Subscription, by the customer. But can also be defined at the event definition stage.
1) When valid field name is given in FIELD,this must be in agreement with the Format rules of the element specified in FIELD.NAME.
for example, the input in FIELD.NAME corresponds to a Customer Mnemonic, a minimum input of 3 characters will be
required in this field.
2) It can also support Keywords like
- !TODAY,
- !LAST.WORKING.DAY,
- !NEXT.WORKING.DAY,
- !OPERATOR (User)
- !EXT..., (EXT.XXX variables set during External user login)
- !CURRENT..., (Current.XXX variables)
3. Input allowed only when ITEM.CLASSIFICATION is ‘BUSINESS’
Indicates the source table subject to the EVENT.
1. Defaulted to the value of source table given in corresponding EB.EVENT.TYPE.
2.Alphanumeric characters. Length: Maximum of 35 characters
3. Must be a valid entry in FILE.CONTROL

When TEC analyses and decides to record an event, it must also check if an event defined in this field has also happened in the same transaction. In which case, it should treat this event as redundant and not record this event.
Validation rules:
1.This should be a valid business event in TEC.ITEMS.
2. Cannot be associated to itself
3. Input allowed only when ITEM.CLASSIFICATION is ‘BUSINESS’
Field to distinguish between technical and business related activities
1.Possible Values - TECHNICAL, BUSINESS
2. Default Value - TECHNICAL
3. NOCHANGE field
This field contains the position of a field. For T type templates or Dynamic arrays, this field can be open for input for the user to define the positions at the time of defining the event.
1. Numeric characters of length '3'.
2. No-input if SOURCE.TABLE is specified.
3. Mandatory if source table is not mentioned and Item classification is 'BUSINESS'
4. NOCHANGE field
The value specified in this field helps to trigger THRESHOLD.TYPE accordingly.
1.1-35 (Numeric) characters.
2.Non Mandatory field.
Accepts a valid field name from the source table or a keyword w.r.t. to the value in the field FIELD.TYPE
1. Alphanumeric characters. Length: Maximum of 25 characters.
2. It must be a valid field name when table is defined.Only D type fields and local reference fields are allowed.
3. It must be a valid Keyword when field Type is KEYWORD.
Following Keywords are supported
- !APPLICATION (Application)
- !V$FUNCTION ( Function)
- !PGM.VERSION( Version of the Application)
- !CHANNEL ( Channel defined in ofs.source)
- !AUTH.NO ( No of Authorisers)
4. Mandatory if Item classification is 'BUSINESS' and when EVENT.API not defined.
5. NOCHANGE field
To specify whether subscription is done at product/customer level
1. Possible Values - CUSTOMER, PRODUCT
2. Mandatory if Item classification is 'BUSINESS' and when EVENT.API is not defined.
Field used to identifies the unit measurement of a TEC.ITEMS records. We have to specify the metric unit based on the METRIC.TYPE and the usability of TEC ITEMS record.
1.1-10 (Alphanumeric) characters.
2.Non Mandatory field.
Identifies the type of THRESHOLD level has to be set based on the THRESHOLD value.
1.1-35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters.
2.Non Mandatory field.
3.This field has a check file validation to TEC.THRESHOLD application.
Allowed values:
IGNORE – Tec metrics triggered below this specified value would not be logged into the TEC.OUTPUT/TEC.DISPLAY(would not be informed to t24monitor also)
INFO – TEC.METRICS updated with the level INFO
WARNING – TEC.METRICS updated with the level WARNING
CRITIAL - TEC.METRICS updated with the level CRITICAL
Field Used to specify the header details of the T24Monitor/TECMonitor.
Usually we have to mention the key names of the headers here.
1.1-20 (Any) characters.
2.Non Mandatory field.
This field defines the nature of context of the field – “FIELD”. It indicates whether value defined in FIELD is an actual field name or a Keyword.
1. Possible Values - FIELD.NAME, KEYWORD
2. Mandatory if Item classification is 'BUSINESS' and when EVENT.API not defined.
3. NOCHANGE field
This field holds the Caption details that have to be displayed on the T24Monitor/TECMonitor screen instead of the METRIC.KEY.
Caption details are being identified by the key names in METRIC.KEY
1.1-35 (Any) characters.
2.Non Mandatory field.
Used to differentiate the TEC Metric items in TECMonitor.
1.1-10 (Alphanumeric) characters.
2.Non Mandatory field.
3.Allowed values – PERFORMANCE,USAGE and INFO
Specify the Metric type of the TEC.ITEMS record to T24Monitor/TECMonitor. If nothing specified then the value would be taken from the field METRIC.TYPE.
1.1-10 (Alphanumeric) characters.
2.Non Mandatory field.
This field is used to describe TEC.ITEMS and is used for enrichment of the Code.
1.1-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
2.Mandatory field.
This field is used to specify a Local API which is to be invoked before recording the event.
Validation rules:
1.The routine entered should have a record on the EB.API application
2. Alphanumeric characters. Length: Maximum of 35 characters.
3. Input allowed only when ITEM.CLASSIFICATION is ‘BUSINESS’
This field is used to indicate whether the associated set of fields and conditions must be displayed to the subscriber on the subscription screen.
1. Allowed values –YES,NO
2. Input allowed only when ITEM.CLASSIFICATION is ‘BUSINESS’
4. NOCHANGE field
This field describes the severity of the event.
Validation rules:
1.Allowed values – CRITICAL, HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW.
2.Input allowed only when ITEM.CLASSIFICATION is ‘BUSINESS’
To specify the type of EVENT
1. This field has a check file validation to EB.EVENT.TYPE application
2. Mandatory if Item classification is 'BUSINESS' and when EVENT.API not defined for the event.
3. NOCHANGE field
When this field holds the value of “Y” then logged TEC metrics will also be written to TEC.OUTPUT.HISTORY file.
1.1-35 (Alphanumeric) characters.
2.Non Mandatory field.
3.Allowed values – Y or NULL
Holds the description of the field given in FIELD. This will be displayed to the subscriber(Customer or DAO) in the subscription screen.
1. Alphanumeric characters. Length: Maximum of 35 characters.
2. Mandatory if Item classification is 'BUSINESS' and when EVENT.API not defined.
3. NOCHANGE field
Field relevant to the EVENT.LIST table and it is no where related to TEC metrics or t24monitor.
1.1-35 (Alphanumeric) characters.
2.Non Mandatory field.
